page.title: 17AN OLD LADY FROM TONBRIDGE:3
page.content: Grace Blaire was born in 1908,the youngest of 4 brothers and a sister.As a girl she wore a frilled voile dress or checked gingham in the summer and kilts and jerseys in the winter. Her mother made most of her clothes, but some new clothes were bought for birthdays and at Christmas.For special occasions she had a navy blue velvet dress with a crotcheted collar and she had a coat with a fur collar and muff. Once a week a wash woman came,so Grace's mother got up early and filled the copper with water.The woman would stay all morning,washing,rinsing and boiling,and would hang it out in the garden to dry.At noon she would demand a cheese sandwich and a glass of beer. Grace is now Mrs Davison and she lives in a very nice house in Speyside with her husband.They have 3 children but do not see them very often.
